article.headline: Winthrop 76, Radford 45
article.story: ROCK HILL, S.C. (AP) -- Antwon Harris scored 14 points to lead Winthrop to a 76-45 victory over Radford on Tuesday night in the Big South Conference tournament quarterfinals. The second-seeded Eagles (20-11) advance to Thursday's semifinals against No. 3 seed High Point, while the Highlanders end their season at 10-20. Winthrop scored the first nine points of the game and never trailed as it tries to win the tournament for the eighth time in the past 10 years. The Eagles dominated the boards, outrebounding Radford 50-33. The Highlanders shot just 24.6 percent (14-of-57) from the field and 18.8 percent (3-of-16) on 3-pointers, while Winthrop shot 49.2 percent (30-of-61) from the field and 50 percent (7-of-14) from behind the arc. Winthrop has won 12 straight over Radford, which hasn't won a Big South tournament game since 2003. Jamar Jenkins led the Highlanders with 12 points, while Joey Lynch-Flohr added seven points and 12 rebounds. Byron Faison and Michael Jenkins each added 12 points for the Eagles.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
